H0.text: Friction is the force that the efficiency of a machine measures how well it reduces.

H1.text: Tension is the force that the efficiency of a machine measures how well it reduces.

H2.text: Vibration is the force that the efficiency of a machine measures how well it reduces.

H3.text: Sound is the force that the efficiency of a machine measures how well it reduces.

A4.text: Friction is the force resisting the relative motion of solid surfaces, fluid layers, and material elements sliding or grinding against each other.

A5.text: Coefficients of friction of various material pairs in atmosphere and vacuum

A6.text: Values for Coefficient of Friction â€“ CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics

A7.text: All real machines lose energy to friction; the energy is dissipated as heat.

A8.text: The mechanical efficiency of a machine is a dimensionless number between 0 and 1 that is the ratio between the power output of the machine and the power input.
